body_html:
Okey!! so the problem is CUDA. Well I have followed some instruction for both CUDA and Cudnn. I have CUDA toolkit 9.4 and Cudnn version as bellow. I want to use Tensorflow-gpu version 1.0.1 because it has more functionalities and also the Deepfix program tells me to install version 1.0.1 only.!!

Also, Do I need to first uninstall current versions of CUDA and then install the next versions or I can just install them directly.?

~$ nvcc --version nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver Copyright (c) 2005-2015 NVIDIA Corporation Built on Tue_Aug_11_14:27:32_CDT_2015 Cuda compilation tools, release 7.5, V7.5.17

Also I have problem in ubuntu that I cant install all the CUDA requirements, if I do so it cretes a login loop..!!

See this link and the 3rd answer is what creates login loop
https://askubuntu.com/questions/223501/ubuntu-gets-stuck-in-a-login-loop

body:
Okey!! so the problem is CUDA. Well I have followed some instruction for both CUDA and Cudnn. I have CUDA toolkit 9.4 and Cudnn version as bellow. I want to use Tensorflow-gpu version 1.0.1 because it has more functionalities and also the Deepfix program tells me to install version 1.0.1 only.!! 

Also, Do I need to first uninstall current versions of CUDA and then install the next versions or I can just install them directly.?

`~$ nvcc --version
nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver
Copyright (c) 2005-2015 NVIDIA Corporation
Built on Tue_Aug_11_14:27:32_CDT_2015
Cuda compilation tools, release 7.5, V7.5.17
`

Also I have problem in ubuntu that I cant install all the CUDA requirements, if I do so it cretes a login loop..!!

See this link and the 3rd answer is what creates login loop
[https://askubuntu.com/questions/223501/ubuntu-gets-stuck-in-a-login-loop](url)
